title: Which word is suitable in the sentence, 'the match had hardly started____ it began to rain'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The match had hardly started ___ it began to rain. Here, the suitable conjunction is ‘when’, because in the above given problem there are two sentences: 1) The match had hardly started and 2) It began to rain. Hence, to join these sentences, the perfect conjunction is ‘when’ because somewhere the issue involved was time. ‘When’ is used to convey the time related matters; as, The match had hardly started when it began to rain.
The match had hardly started when it began to rain. When, the preposition of time is to be filled in the blank.
